CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National Edition, June 6, 1942, pg. 1 reads: " When the naval recruiting office threw its doors open Monday to Negroes for the first time in a decade, Robert Frye, Pittsburgh Courier engraver, was the first recruit in line. He was accepted after a thorough examination and will leave soon for a naval training center. Seated beside Frye is Alfred W. Landucci (Left), yeoman second class U.S. Naval Reserve and Ensign Marshall B. Smith. Standing at the left is Lieut. Elmer B. Keckler, and at the right, Robert M. McChesney, storekeeper first class, Naval Reserve. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Robert Frye seated at desk signing document, and Lieut. Elmer B. Keckler wearing military uniform standing beside him, in interior with recruitment posters that read "Naval Aviation..." and "Man the Guns, Join the Navy"
